briefdescription.para: Whether and why integration is finished.
The Gyoto::Metric in this part of the universe.
Coordinate of first base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of first base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of first base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of first base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of Second base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of Second base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of Second base vector to parallel transport.
Coordinate of Second base vector to parallel transport.

detaileddescription.para: Size of x0_, x1_... arrays

briefdescription.para: Minimum index for which x0_, x1_... have been computed.
Index of initial condition in array.
Maximum index for which x0_, x1_... have been computed.
Whether integration should use adaptive delta.
Experimental: choose 0 to compute only primary image.

detaileddescription.para: This feature is in development.

briefdescription.para: Whether to parallel transport a local triad.

detaileddescription.para: Typically used to trace the base in which the Stokes parameters are expressed in the context of polarization.
Default: GYOTO_DEFAULT_DELTA

briefdescription.para: Time limit for the integration (geometrical units)

detaileddescription.para: Computation does not go back before tmin_. Default is -DBL_MAX. tmin_ is always expressed in geometrical units, it is essentially a tuning parameter for the ray-tracing process. tmin_ should be chosen to always be longer than the distance between the screen and the object.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of iterations when integrating.
Minimum integration step for the adaptive integrator.

detaileddescription.para: The default (GYOTO_DEFAULT_DELTA_MIN) is usually fine.
For IntegState::Legacy, set it in the Metric instead!

briefdescription.para: Maximum integration step for the adaptive integrator.

detaileddescription.para: The default (GYOTO_DEFAULT_DELTA_MAX) is usually fine.
For IntegState::Legacy, set it in the Metric instead!
For IntegState::Legacy, set it in the Metric instead!
Ensure that delta (the numerical integration step) is never larger than a fraction of the distance between the current location and the center of the coordinate system.
The default (GYOTO_DEFAULT_DELTA_MAX_OVER_R) is usually fine.
Used by the adaptive integrators implemented in IntegState::Boost. Refer to the boost::numeric::odeint documentation for more details.
Used by the adaptive integrators implemented in IntegState::Boost. Refer to the boost::numeric::odeint documentation for more details.

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of crossings of equatorial plane.

detaileddescription.para: Used to determine how much higher-order image features should be kept.

briefdescription.para: An object to hold the integration state.

memberdef.argsstring: (Worldline *orig, size_t i0, int dir, double step_max)
memberdef.name: Worldline

detaileddescription.para: Meant to instantiate a copy of orig with a smaller step to refine integration, for instance for more accurate radiative transfer integration.
See Photon::Photon(Photon* orig, size_t i0, int dir, double step_max) and Photon::Refined.

parameterdescription.para: Worldline to refine
Index of coordinate in orig to take as initial condition
Direction of integration
Maximum integration step

memberdef.argsstring: (const double coord[8], int dir, double const Ephi[4], double const Etheta[4])
memberdef.name: setInitCoord

detaileddescription.para: Set imin_=imax_=i0_, and x[i0]=coord[].

emphasis.emphasis: If dir==1, i0_ is set to 0. If dir==-1, i0_ is set to x_size_-1.
If dir==0 and the Worldine has never been computed (i0_==0, imin_==1 and imax_==0), then dir defaults to 1 for a massive particle and -1 for a massless particle.
If dir==0 and the Worldine has already been computed, i0_ is not changed.

parameterdescription.para: new initial coordinates
direction of integration. 1 for forward integration, -1 for backards integration, 0 for unknown or both
initial value of base vector to parallel-transport. Ignored if parallel_transport_ is false.
initial value of base vector to parallel-transport. Ignored if parallel_transport_ is false.

detaileddescription.para: Set imin_=imax_=i0_, and x[i0]=coord[].

emphasis.emphasis: If dir==1, i0_ is set to 0. If dir==-1, i0_ is set to x_size_-1.
If dir==0 and the Worldine has never been computed (i0_==0, imin_==1 and imax_==0), then dir defaults to 1 for a massive particle and -1 for a massless particle.
If dir==0 and the Worldine has already been computed, i0_ is not changed.

parameterdescription.para: new initial coordinates
direction of integration. 1 for forward integration, -1 for backards integration, 0 for unknown or both

memberdef.argsstring: (double const pos[4], double const vel[3], int dir=0)
memberdef.name: setInitCoord

parameterdescription.para: initial 4-position
initial 3-velocity
direction of integration

detaileddescription.para: Initialize state_ to use the required integrator.

parameterdescription.para: Either "Legacy" or (if GYOTO_HAVE_BOOST_INTEGRATORS) one of "runge_kutta_cash_karp54", "runge_kutta_fehlberg78", "runge_kutta_dopri5", "runge_kutta_cash_karp54_classic"

briefdescription.para: Describe the integrator used by state_.
Set the integrator kind to 3+1 or 4D.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize state_ to use the required geodesic equation.

briefdescription.para: Get the kind of geodesic equation integrated by state_.

detaileddescription.para: Get delta max at a given position

parameterdescription.para: 4-position
external constraint on delta_max

simplesect.para: the smallest value between delta_max_, delta_max_external, and R*delta_max_over_r_ where R is pos[1] in spherical coordinates and max(x1, x2, x3) in Cartesian coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Set delta_max_

briefdescription.para: Expand memory slots for polarization vectors.

detaileddescription.para: Assignment to another Worldline Set delta_

briefdescription.para: Returns the worldline's cst of motion (if any)

detaileddescription.para: Return pointer to array holding the previously set Metric-specific constants of motion.

This function returns a pointer to the actual storage location and should be handled with care. std::vector<double> Worldline:constantsOfMotion() const provides a convenient way to retrieve a copy of the content.
The will (re)allocate Worldline::cst_, copy cst into it, and set Worldline::cst_n_.
This is the same as void Worldline:constantsOfMotion(std::vector<double> const cstv) using a C-style array instead of a vector.
The will (re)allocate Worldline::cst_, copy cst into it, and set Worldline::cst_n_.
This is the same as getCst using a vector instead of a C-style array.

briefdescription.para: Return a copy of the Metric-specific constants of motion.

detaileddescription.para: This funtion return a copy of the constants of motion. getCst() can be used to retrieve a pointer to the actual array used internally which is slightly more efficient for read-only access.

memberdef.argsstring: (SmartPointer< Metric::Generic > gg, const double coord[8], const int dir, double const Ephi[4], double const Etheta[4])
memberdef.name: setInitialCondition

briefdescription.para: Set or re-set the initial condition prior to integration.

parameterdescription.para: Gyoto::SmartPointer to the Gyoto::Metric in this universe;
8 element array containing the initial condition, i.e. the 4-position and the 4-velocity of the Photon at the receiving end;
direction: 1 for future, -1 for past.
initial value of base vector to parallel-transport. Ignored if parallel_transport_ is false.
initial value of base vector to parallel-transport. Ignored if parallel_transport_ is false.

memberdef.argsstring: (SmartPointer< Metric::Generic > gg, const double coord[8], const int dir)
memberdef.name: setInitialCondition

briefdescription.para: Set or re-set the initial condition prior to integration.

parameterdescription.para: Gyoto::SmartPointer to the Gyoto::Metric in this universe;
8 element array containing the initial condition, i.e. the 4-position and the 4-velocity of the Photon at the receiving end;
direction: 1 for future, -1 for past.

detaileddescription.para: Depending on the size of dest and on the value of parallel_transport_, get position (xi_), velocity (xidot_) and possibly other triad vectors (epi_ and eti_).

briefdescription.para: Get coordinates+base vectors corresponding to index.

detaileddescription.para: Depending on the value of parallel_transport_, get position (xi_), velocity (xidot_) and possibly other triad vectors (epi_ and eti_). coord is resized to the right number of elements.

briefdescription.para: Get coordinates+base vectors corresponding to index.

detaileddescription.para: We need this non-const implementation to allow the const, size_t and the non-const, double implementations to coexist.

briefdescription.para: Get coordinates+base vectors corresponding to date dest[0].

detaileddescription.para: Depending on the value of parallel_transport_, get position (xi_), velocity (xidot_) and possibly other triad vectors (epi_ and eti_). coord is resized to the right number of elements.

briefdescription.para: Get Cartesian expression of 4-position at index.
Fill x0, x1... by integrating the Worldline from previously set inittial condition to time tlim.
Get computed proper times or values of the affine parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (double const *const dates, size_t const n_dates, double *const x, double *const y, double *const z, double *const xprime=NULL, double *const yprime=NULL, double *const zprime=NULL)
memberdef.name: getCartesian

briefdescription.para: Get the 6 Cartesian coordinates for specific dates.

detaileddescription.para: The 6 coordinates (x, y, z, dx/dt, dy/dt, dz/dt) will be computed using the integrator and interpolated if necessary, so they will be as accurate as possible. Transforming to Cartesian coordinates is not necessarily meaningful.

parameterdescription.para: List of dates for which the coordinates are to be computed;
Number of dates to compute ;
Arrays in which to store the result. These pointer may be set to NULL to retrieve only part of the information. Else, they must be pre-allocated.

briefdescription.para: Get 3-position in cartesian coordinates for computed dates.

memberdef.argsstring: (double const *const dates, size_t const n_dates, double *const x1dest, double *const x2dest, double *const x3dest, double *const x0dot=NULL, double *const x1dot=NULL, double *const x2dot=NULL, double *const x3dot=NULL, double *ep0=NULL, double *ep1=NULL, double *ep2=NULL, double *ep3=NULL, double *et0=NULL, double *et1=NULL, double *et2=NULL, double *et3=NULL, double *otime=NULL, bool proper=false)
memberdef.name: getCoord

detaileddescription.para: The coordinates will be computed using the integrator, so they will be as accurate as possible. Some heuristics are used to speed up the process and it is presumably faster to call this routine with a sorted list of dates. The line will be integrated further as required. An error will be thrown if it is not possible to reach a certain date.

parameterdescription.para: the list of dates for which the coordinates are to be computed in proper time or affine parameter if #proper is true or in coordinate time if #proper is false (default);
the number of dates to compute ;
arrays in which to store the result. These pointer may be set to NULL to retrieve only part of the information. They must be pre-allocated.
arrays in which to store the ephi and etheta (parallel transport case). These pointer may be set to NULL to retrieve only part of the information. They must be pre-allocated.
array in which to store the other time: coordinate time if #proper, else proper time or affine parameter.
bool: whether #dates is proper time (or affine parameter) or coordinate time.

detaileddescription.para: Get all the pre-computed 8 coordinates (e.g. thanks to a prior call to xFill()) of this worldline.

checkPhiTheta() Modifies coord if the corrdinates are spherical-like so that coord[2]=theta is in [0,pi] and coord[3]=phi is in [0,2pi]. Important to use in all astrobj in spherical coordinates to prevent "z-axis problems".

memberdef.argsstring: (SmartPointer< Screen > screen, double *dalpha, double *ddellta, double *dD) const
memberdef.name: getSkyPos

briefdescription.para: Get computed positions in sky coordinates.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *const filename, double const t1, double const mass_sun, double const distance_kpc, std::string const unit, SmartPointer< Screen > sc=NULL)
memberdef.name: save_txyz

briefdescription.para: Allocate x0, x1 etc. with default size.

detaileddescription.para: The default size is GYOTO_DEFAULT_X_SIZE

briefdescription.para: Allocate x0, x1 etc. with a specified size.

parameterdescription.para: : number of cells in each array x0, x1 etc.

briefdescription.para: Expand x0, x1 etc... to hold more elements.

detaileddescription.para: Double the size of arrays x0, x1 etc. and copy old version of the array in the first half if dir =1 and in the second half if dir =-1.

parameterdescription.para: : 1 to expand after last element, -1 to expand before first element

simplesect.para: ind : if dir=1, new index of old last element, if dir=-1, new index of old first element

briefdescription.para: Expand one array to hold more elements.

detaileddescription.para: If you need to expand more arrays than x0_ ... x3_ and the dots, call this on your array before calling xExpand(int dir).

parameterdescription.para: array to expand

detaileddescription.para: Allocate memory for polarization vectors
Deallocate memory for polarization vectors
Call xExpand(double * &x, int dir) on #ep0_, ep1_ etc.

briefdescription.para: This is how a Teller tells.

detaileddescription.para: A teller will basically call listener->tell(this).

parameterdescription.para: Teller* the Teller who is telling... Useful if the Listener listens to several Tellers.

detaileddescription.para: Their are two derived classes: Photon and Star. A Worldline can be integrated from an initial condition either backward or forward in time using xFill() (Photon::hit() also integrates the Worldline). Member state_ holds the integration state as well as an integrator. There are several kinds of integration states, that derive from IntegState::Generic.

The coordinates of the Worldline are stored in x0_, x1_, x2_, x3_, x0dot_, x1dot_, x2dot_ ans x3dot_. Those arrays are extended as needed using xExpand(). These coordinates can be retrieved using get_t(), get_xyz(), getCartesian(), getCoord() etc.
